MS MCQs

    Use control flows in Go

    »

    1. Can variables that are declared within an if statement be used outside the if statement?

      Yes, because variables have a global scope.

      No, the variable scope is only within the if block or nested if statements.

      Yes, as long as they’re used within the function.

      No, a variable must be declared outside an if statement.


    2. In a switch block, does a break keyword need to be included at the end of every case statement?

      No, Go doesn’t require you to include the break keyword.

      Yes, otherwise the following case statements will be evaluated.

      No, Go doesn’t support the break keyword.


    3. What does the panic() function do in Go?

      It throws an error that you need to catch. Otherwise, the program crashes without any error.

      It prints a panic message to the console.

      It crashes a program and prints the error message and its stack trace.
